conclusion: Analyze forces on the copper rod MN before and after energizing.
Determine tension in wires when rod is not energized: 2T0 = mg, T0 = mg/2.
When rod is energized, additional magnetic force acts on it.
Magnetic force on rod: FB = IBL.
Direction of magnetic force is upward due to right-hand rule.
New tension in each wire: T = T0/4 = mg/8.
Substitute T = mg/8 and FB = IBL: mg/4 + IBL = mg.
Determine current direction: from M to N.
Final answer: Current magnitude is 3mg/4BL, direction from M to N.
